hypothesis_content.title: Neutral Regime ETH/BTC Ratio Reversion After Extreme Divergence
hypothesis_content.statement: When the ETH/BTC ratio (ETH price / BTC price) deviates >2.5 standard deviations from its 30-day rolling mean during a NEUTRAL regime, it will revert to its mean within 5 trading days with >70% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes often feature rotational flows between major cryptos without strong directional bias. Extreme ETH/BTC divergences during low volatility periods are typically driven by transient factors (e.g., single-asset news) that correct as attention normalizes.
entry_conditions: ETH/BTC ratio crosses outside +/- 2.5σ band of its 30-day rolling mean
Trade direction: Long ratio if below -2.5σ, short ratio if above +2.5σ

exit_conditions.take_profit: Ratio returns to within +/- 0.5σ of 30-day mean
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Ratio moves further to +/- 3.5σ from mean

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 50% of signals result in stop-loss hits before take-profit or time exit over a 100-signal backtest period.
